CatDescriptText: Kenvin Moureau, college instructor, McKeesport and Mrs. A. Batts, laundry worker, Manchester, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 8, 1960, pg. 33 with question: "In your opinion, which political party, Republican or Democratic, has the best record of keeping its campaign pledges to the people of the United States?  Which party do you think would be most successful in carrying out its 1960 campaign platform-this being a Presidential election year?"  Mr. Moureau's answer reads: "In the past, the Democrats have...The answer is based on the eras of Roosevelt, Truman and Eisenhower...The Republicans have found it harder to keep promises because they have been in office during great changes in the world situation.  The Democrats would better carry out its 1960 campaign platform."  Mrs. Batts' answer reads: "In both instances, the Democrats...Their past record, since Roosevelt, of keeping their pledges, make me believe they will continue to do better than the Republicans."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Kenvin Moureau wearing short sleeve button down collared shirt standing in front of tiled wall; Portrait of Mrs. A. Batts wearing dark cardigan and dress with lace bodice, standing in front of automobiles and General Office Equipment Corp. sign, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
